p: The ratio of certain secondary photochemical products, such as H 2O 2/NO Z and H 2O 2/HNO 3, can be used as the efficient indicators to distinguish NO X- or VOC-sensitive regimes of O 3 chemistry (Xie et al., 2014). In this study, H 2O 2/HNO 3 is adopted to investigate the O 3–NO X-VOC sensitivity in the YRD under different climate conditions. According to the previous study [ 8], the transition value of H 2O 2/HNO 3 in the present summer is quantified to be 0.3–0.5, while it will change to 0.4–0.8 under the future conditions.
